text: @faxoncr precisely, since it wasn’t targeted toward them of course they see no problem🤷‍♂️

that’s what people who were arguing with me didn’t understand. they said “the ad wasn’t bad, it was a reminder to be a better man.” but they overlooked 2 things: 1. most of the examples in the ad were stupid and untrue, i.e., man trying to date a woman by thinking she was attractive and walking toward her, and man correcting a woman when she absolutely could’ve been wrong, or saying dads don’t stop fights between kids. all things women could’ve done. and 2. if the ad were reversed, like Piers just proved, women would be mortified.
Also shoutout to @harmfmiller3 for liking a post of mine mid screen record haha👌🏻👌🏻💯💯
